Expectation1: Ensuring financial stability for the family
Situation1: A home loan repayment is due in two months, and the father needs to prepare for it
Expectation2: Follow traffic laws and drive defensively
Situation2: Steady rain and frequent lane changes from nearby cars raise the risk of sudden stops
Story: The rain drums steadily on the windshield as I grip the steering wheel, eyes darting between the slick road and the meter ticking away. My mind isn’t just on the traffic—though the cars weaving in and out, their taillights blurring in the downpour, demand every ounce of my attention. It’s the home loan payment looming in two months that gnaws at me. I promised my wife we’d never fall behind, that our kids would always have a roof over their heads. Every extra fare counts, and tonight, the streets are busy. If I push a little harder, take a few more rides, maybe I can get ahead. But the roads are treacherous, and I know the risks—one wrong move, one moment of impatience, and I could end up in an accident. My duty as a father pulls me one way, desperate to provide, while my responsibility as a driver tugs the other, reminding me to keep everyone safe. My heart pounds as I approach a yellow light, torn between slowing down and speeding through, the weight of both roles pressing in on me.
